title: 109_hr3204
content: The "State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005" extends funding for state high risk health insurance pools. The "State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005" authorizes appropriations of $15,000,000 for seed grants and $50,000,000 for the operation of pools for fiscal years 2005 through 2009. The funds remain available for obligation through the following fiscal year. The "State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005" authorizes appropriations for seed grants and operational grants for qualified high risk pools. Changes in requirements include adjusting premium percentages and extending grant availability beyond fiscal year 2004. The State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005 authorizes grants to reduce premiums for enrollees in qualified high risk pools, with changes in definitions to allow alternative enrollment mechanisms. The State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005 authorizes grants for high risk pools, with changes in definitions for standard risk rates and effective dates for fiscal years starting in 2005. The State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005 authorizes grants for high risk pools, with changes in allotment formula for operational grants starting in fiscal year 2005. The State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005 authorizes grants for high risk pools, with changes in allotment formula for operational grants starting in fiscal year 2005. Funding will be allocated among qualifying States based on the number of uninsured individuals and those enrolled in health care coverage through the qualified high risk pool. The State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005 authorizes grants for high risk pools based on the number of uninsured individuals and those enrolled in health care coverage through qualified high risk pools. States must submit applications for eligibility, and there is no entitlement to a grant. The Secretary is required to submit an annual report on grants provided under this section. The State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005 authorizes grants for high risk pools based on the number of uninsured individuals and those enrolled in health care coverage. States must submit applications for eligibility, and the Secretary is required to submit an annual report on the distribution of grants among states and the use of grant funds. Additionally, bonus grants for supplemental consumer benefits are provided to states that have established qualified high risk pools. The State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005 authorizes grants for high risk pools to provide supplemental consumer benefits such as low-income premium subsidies, premium reductions, and expanding eligibility for coverage. The State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005 authorizes grants for high risk pools to provide benefits with a 10% limitation on grant amounts and funding availability for two fiscal years. The State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005 authorizes grants for high risk pools with a 10% limitation on grant amounts and funding availability for two fiscal years. If funds are not fully utilized by June 30 of a fiscal year, remaining amounts will be reallocated among qualifying States according to a specified formula. The State High Risk Pool Funding Extension Act of 2005 was passed by the House of Representatives on July 27, 2005.
